me.ashtheking.island

Class IslandGen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • me.ashtheking.island.IslandGen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class IslandGen
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the main class of the project. IslandGen not only generates the elevation map, but also renders and draws all modules.
    Author:
    Ashwin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • midpoint

        public static void midpoint(double[][] array,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            double c1,
            double c2,
            double c3,
            double c4)
        Midpoint takes the array and runs the midpoint-displacement algorithim upon it to generate the elevation map.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be run on.
        x - The starting X value
        y - The starting Y value
        width - The width of the generation to run
        height - The height of the generation to run
        c1 - A corner of the array
        c2 - A corner of the array
        c3 - A corner of the array
        c4 - A corner of the array

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Method called to create the generation thread.

      • generate1

        public void generate1()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Actual generation method. First seeds the array with random values. Then it seeds the array so it will generate an island. It then runs the midpoint-displacement algorithm to generate the array. Models erosion while calculating values of the loaded moisture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • loadedModule

        public void loadedModule(Module m)
        Loads the module specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        m - The module to be loaded.
